intro: Moenchia cerastoides, commonly known as the common sandspurry, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, and the plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Moenchia cerastoides is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to dry, nutrient-poor environments.
